title: Ticket #1794: Debian Condor builds leak shared memory segments
description:
On nmi-0013, nmi-0199, nmi-0200, I see shared memory segments leaked, one per day. I believe that this is related to the use of 'fakeroot', which was failing on 0013 a couple of weeks ago, until I cleaned up leaked resources. I informed Thawan (who reported the fakeroot problem to me) of the leak, but it appears to not be fixed.

You can view the open IPC resources with: 

$ ipcs -t

and remove them with: 

$ ipcrm

I'll take another pass at cleaning up the leaked resources, but this needs to be resolved.
creator: nleroy
